channel.title: Memory usage, possible leak?
channel.description:
Can someone tell me what would be considered a good memory usage for a private server?
I was on around 9k when the server was stable, started to add some content to handle everything on the server, and now it varies between 18-25k.
Is this because of the content that has been added, or could it be a possible leak somewhere?

item.title: Memory usage, possible leak?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You can try using one of the countless memory analysers/code profilers. Most IDEs should have one built-in.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory usage, possible leak?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Yeah I just thought it was a huge jump. If it is a leak, are there any tools I can use to help me find where the leak is coming from? (If it’s a leak that is)

Read full topic

item.title: Memory usage, possible leak?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

25000kb of memory is 25mb lmfao that’s low as hell considering most people allocate 512-1024mb of memory to the jvm…

you have nothing to be worried about, program smartly and you’ll have no problems with memory in the future

Read full topic

item.title: Memory usage, possible leak?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“RUNE-PK, post:2, topic:539367”]Most likely a leak[/quote]but java has garbage collection. SCIENCE CAN’T EXPLAIN THAT
